title._content: [Unidentified city garden, probably in New York, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Unidentified city garden, probably in New York, New York. Pathway with Rose of Sharon (hybiscus syriacus)] [ca. 1922] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: This slide is one of four that walks the viewer from a brick walk, up a stairway, and into a city garden: J717-X98-60, J717-X107-4, J717-X017-21, J717-X017-29. On slide: Blue star sticker and red seal sticker. Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16673 Call Number: LC-J717-X107- 29
